intro: Ceodes umbellifera f. acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ceodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, giving it a delicate appearance. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where it often grows in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
